did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: 20 separate volumes including diaries, account books and letter books. One pass admitting F.A. Curtiss, brother of Homer Curtiss, to the Fairfax General Hospital where Homer Curtiss was recovering from a battlefield wound.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Homer S. Curtiss b. 1841 son of Erastus & Joanna Sturtevant (m. 24 Dec 1837 in Warren) d. 17 Mar 1875 bur. Mt. Grove Cemetery, Bridgeport Homer Curtiss enlisted in Company H, Connecticut 2nd Heavy Artillery Regiment on 11 Sep 1862.Promoted to Full Sergeant on 25 Jan 1863. Promoted to Full 2nd Lieutenant on 05 May 1864. Promoted to Full 1st Lieutenant on 19 Feb 1865. Promoted to Brevet Captain on 06 Apr 1865. Mustered out on 18 Aug 1865 at Fort Ethan Allen, DC. He married Alice Bradley 16 November 1870 and became the father of Leslie Sackett and the artist, Katharine Sackett.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Homer Curtiss diaries cover the period immediately before and after the Civil War. They contain his observations on weather, family members as well as his experiences in the war and his reactions to world events such as the assassination of President Lincoln.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The diaries are contained in one archival container.
